FuncDef:
The ipv4-flow vpn-instance command enables the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family and displays its view.
The undo ipv4-flow vpn-instance command deletes the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family view.
By default, the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To enable the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family and enter its view, run the ipv4-flow vpn-instance command. Then you can perform configurations in the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family view.
Prerequisites
A BGP VPN instance has been created and its view has been displayed using the vpn-instance command.
Configuration Impact
After the ipv4-flow vpn-instance command is run, the created BGP Flow Specification route is automatically imported to the BGP VPN routing table.
Precautions
The undo ipv4-flow vpn-instance command deletes all configurations from the BGP-Flow VPN instance IPv4 address family view and deletes BGP Flow Specification routes from the BGP VPN routing table.
